author: bonnie nguyen
text: 'probably worst mapo tofu i‚Äôve ever had. it has peas in it'

author: Tyler Steinetz
text: 'Sweet baby Jesus. This might be the best Asian food I‚Äôve ever had in Hoboken. It‚Äôs fresh. It‚Äôs not greasy. It‚Äôs shammmmmwow!!!!!! Try this place for your next order in night and you won‚Äôt regret it!!!!!'

author: Bingfa Chen
text: 'good food'

author: Jessica Wang
text:
'I gave this place a 4-star review when it first opened. We were glad to have a place nearby to order good dim sum. We had since ordered from here many times.

But our recent experience had not been good.

A couple of weeks ago when I got home with my takeout order
column5: two of the dishes were not what I ordered.\n\nFor my most recent order over the phone
column6: I was given an ETA of ~25 minutes. When I got there 30 minutes later
column7: I was told it was not ready yet. I knew ETA was not meant to be exact
column8: so I paid and waited inside. 20 minutes later
column9: I inquired on my order again and was only told then that their chef was out and just got back. He could now start working on my order. I decided to have my money back and left.\n\nI wish the guy who took my order and watched me wait had the courtesy to inform me of the real situation earlier. Instead
column10: they just lost a customer for good.'

author: Boyet Santos
text: "Food is good
column5: clean place and you don't wait too long ."

author: Lee McGrath
text: 'Great food
column5: very friendly staff. Order ahead because they cook to order'

author: Jennifer Spadavecchia
text: 'All im gonna say is Scallion Toast'

author: Angel Ng
text: 'Amazing food
column5: friendly staffs

author: Danielle Wang
text: 'Great food
column5: amazing quality

author: xiulan chen
text: 'Can‚Äôt believe we have a new Dim Sum place now in hoboken
column5: food is great
column6: amazing quality even comparing to ones in NYC

author: Frank Frattolillio
text: 'Ok. Very expensive.  Much better Chinese food in Hoboken at a cheaper price.'

author: CC Mizrahi
text: 'Order ahead
column5: food takes a bit to prepare. Worth the wait though!'

author: carl chwiej
text: 'Best dim sum for miles.  You will love it!'

author: Dan H
text: "Decent dim sum option
column5: but pricing on delivery services are highly predatory. For example
column6: several item that are priced $14.95 on their menu is somehow $19.50 on UberEats. This is before taxes and fees. I believe the store sets the price. So ordering 2 such items will add a premium of close to $15 with taxes and fees
column7: even before delivery fee and tip.\n\nNote to owner - come on
column8: I realize that serving on delivery apps costs money but you can't just pass all the fees back to the customer
column9: the prices are so unrealistic! Paying the platform is just the cost of doing business!"

author: Calvin Kwon
text: 'All the food seems fresh and delicious. Would definitely order again. We got fried dumplings
column5: XLB
column6: and beef chow fun. Highly recommend the beef chow fun'

author: Qiao Jiang
text: 'Made an online order. It took one hour to get my food. This is absurd as a dim sum restaurant. I would have picked any dim sum order from Fort Lee. Not worth it.'

author: Sikang Hu
text: 'I made an order online
column5: and they told me to wait 25-40min. However
column6: I actually waited more than one hour. I came to the restaurant and waited there for more than 40 minutes. It is really a terrible experience. Also
column7: It is really hard to find a parking spot near Washington St.'

author: South Lions
text: 'Come Try Our Delicious Dim Sum!!!!!'

author: Wei Wang
text: 'Even though this might be the only dim sum place you can find in hoboken
column5: but it‚Äôs super authentic that it might be even better than some of the places in Chinatown. MUST TRY!!!!'

author: Andy Chen
text: 'fresh and tasty
column5: really authentic dim sum'

author: Shweta Kamat
text: 'Excellent food. We tried their house pork dumplings
column5: bean curd skin with shrimp
column6: rice and mushroom in lotus leaf
column8: salt n pepper squid. Every dish tasted so good. Will definitely try more dimsum from here. Great addition to Hoboken.'

author: Liza Gomelski
text: 'Super enjoyable. Got to try several dishes at an affordable price
column5:
not everything was for me but that‚Äôs the beauty of places like this. You can keep coming back and trying out a new dish.

The server was lovely.

Excited to come back!'

author: Zheng Fa
text: 'Unbelievable food quality for a takeout restaurant. Highly recommended'

column5: even better than some places in china town'

author: Kenny L
text: 'Really good dim sum.'

author: Gary Wong
text: "very solid selection of food. the wait was super long.  I guess that's how it is though given the freshness."

text: 'We absolutely enjoyed trying different dumplings and buns!! I am so glad we have this place in Hoboken!! üíØ recommended'

author: Nadia Alaeddin
text: 'So so good. Best General Tso in town. I know because I‚Äôve tried them all.'

author: Queenie Dong
text: 'Finally have a transitional Dim Sum in the Hoboken
column5:
great taste just same as Chinatown in New York. Friendly employees! Definitely will come back again.

Tip:
They are not done-in type of restaurant so better order ahead by phone or online.'

author: Lantian Zhang
text: 'Tried it for the first time tonight and the taste didn‚Äôt disappoint. Very glad we can have an authentic dim sum place in downtown Hoboken.'

author: Lisa Wy
text: 'What attracts me is that the dim sum tastes great'

author: Janina Pirela
text: 'Food was very greasy. The beef short rib and pork short rib was extremely fatty and had little to no flavor. Pork one looked a bit sketch
column5: didn‚Äôt eat more than one bite. The crispy pork and shrimp dumplings were greasy and the dumpling itself was extremely thick and chewy
column6: hardly any filling. Shrimp Shu Mai and pork soup dumpling were alright.'

author: Karen Wang
text: 'Popped in to order a handful of items off the dim sum menu and it was ready in 15 minutes (3 laps around the block). HIGHLY recommend the shrimp dumplings
column5: shumai
column6: and steamed pork buns. It‚Äôs about time Hoboken got an authentic dim sum place! I can‚Äôt wait to try more stuff off the menu.'

author: Josh Nicholas
text: 'meh'

author: Leo
text: 'interesting interesting interesting'

author: Jiaren Li
text: 'Overall
column5: this was a good dim sum food place you can get in the Hoboken area. We ordered a bunch of dim sum dishes and they were all tasty and fairly authentic. Staff there were also very friendly and accommodating. As a new establishment it seems like still getting setup
column6: but still worth a visit for a quick bite.\nHave to come back again for their entree and tea another day. Wait time is a bit long depends on when you go and it is pricy compare to Chinatown. It is also not the cart experience you get traditionally. but I would still frequent here for the food.'

author: Andy Chen
text: 'Most authentic Cantonese food on Hoboken!!!!!!'

author: Congmin He
text: 'The food here is delicious
column5: especially the dim sum!'

author: Jessica Dong
text: 'Loved it! The food is very tasty and is real chinese cuisine. Would come back again when i have the time to. Service is great too!'

author: Feng Liu
text: 'Food is fine
column5: but over priced. Long waiting time. Bubble tea is not open yet
column6: not sure why the previous reviewers posted reviews about that.'
